newsitem.title: FRANCE: Lyonnaise wins Indonesia water contract.
newsitem.headline: Lyonnaise wins Indonesia water contract.

text.p: French utilities group Lyonnaise des Eaux said on Friday that a consortium in which it holds 70 percent has signed a contract to produce a drinking water system for the fourth-largest city in Indonesia, Medan.
The 25-year contract is expected to generate more than $2 billion in turnover during its lifetime, or $80 million a year on average, Lyonnaise said in a statement.
Fewer than half of Medan's 2.5 million inhabitants are supplied with drinking water and the city's population is expected to grow to eight million by 2015, it said.
Lyonnaise leads the consortium, which includes local partners, and will manage the installations.
